ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Assessment type
Notes: 1=TADS GATE A; 2=TADS GATE B; 3 = TADS Gate C; 4 = TADS Week 6; 5 = TADS Week 12; 6 = TADS Week 18; 7 = TADS Week 24; 8 = TADS Week 30; 9 = TADS Week 36; 10 = TADS F/U Mo 3; 11 = TADS F/U Mo 6; 12 = TADS F/U Mo 9; 13 = TADS F/U Mo 12; 14 = SOFTAD month 6; 15 = SOFTAD month 12; 16 = SOFTAD month 18; 17 = SOFTAD month 24; 18 = SOFTAD month 30; 19 = SOFTAD month 36; 20 = SOFTAD month 42

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Weeks from Time 0/baseline to assessment
Female informant relationship to the teenager
Notes: 0 = No female caretaker present 1 = Biological mother 2 = Adoptive mother 3 = Foster mother 4 = Stepmother 5 = Grandmother 6 = Sister 7 = Aunt 8 = Other

ElementDescription: Male informant relationship to the teenager
Notes: 0 = No male caretaker present 1 = Biological father 2 = Adoptive father 3 = Foster father 4 = Stepfather 5 = Grandfather 6 = Brother 7 = Uncle 8 = Other

ElementDescription: Current Grade
Is teen currently enrolled in school? (alternatively, does teen plan to return to school when it resumes)
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= Yes, college; 3= Yes, high school

ElementDescription: Number of school days missed during last two months of school (alternatively, the last two months school was in session)
Is the child/teen adopted?
Is the teen's mother living?
If the teen's mother is not living, how old was the teen when she died?
Is the teen's father living?
If the teen's father is not living, how old was the teen when he died?
Do the teen's parents currently live together?
Notes: 0 = Parents live together 1 = Parents do not live together 2 = Unknown

ElementDescription: Are the teen's parents currently married to each other?
Notes: 0 = Never married 1 = Married 2 = Legally separated 3 = Divorced 4 = One or both parents(s) deceased 5 = Unknown

ElementDescription: Is the teen's mother currently married to someone other than the teen's father (or living with a significant other)?
Is the teen's father currently married to someone other than the teen's mother (or living with a significant other)?
Does the teen have any brothers or sisters?
Number of full or half brothers
Number of full or half sisters
Number of step-brothers
Number of step-sisters

ElementDescription: Primary female caretaker/mother figure (maternal demographics)
Notes: 0 = No female caretaker 1 = Biological mother 2 = Adoptive mother 3 = Foster mother 4 = Stepmother 5 = Grandmother 6 = Sister 7 = Aunt 8 = Other 9 = Other female relative 10 = Other female non-relative

ElementDescription: Mother figure/primary female caretaker: highest year in school completed
Notes: 1 = Did not complete high school 2 = Completed GED / high schooldiploma program 3 = High school graduate 4 = Attended trade school / community college 5 = Associate's degree (2-yearprogram) 6 = Attended 4-year college / university 7 = Bachelor's degree 8 = Attended graduate or professional school 9    = Master's degree / law degree 10 = Doctoral degree or equivalent

ElementDescription: Age of mother figure/primary female caretaker at last birthday
Race/ethnic background of mother figure/primary female caretaker
Notes: 1 = Caucasian 2 = African American 3 = Hispanic, black 4 = Hispanic, white 5 = Asian 6 = Native American 7 = Pacific Islander 8 = Other

ElementDescription: Mother figure/primary female caretaker fluency in English
Notes: 1 = Fluent in English 2 = Somewhat fluent in English 3 = Not fluent in English

ElementDescription: Primary male caretaker/father figure (paternal demographics)
Notes: 0 = No male caretaker 1 = Biological father 2 = Adoptive father 3 = Foster father 4 = Stepfather 5 = Grandfather 6 = Brother 7 = Uncle 8 = Other 9 = Other male relative 10 = Other male non-relative

ElementDescription: Father figure/primary male caretaker: highest year in school completed
Notes: 1 = Did not complete high school 2 = Completed GED / high schooldiploma program 3 = High school graduate 4 = Attended trade school / community college 5 = Associate's degree (2-yearprogram) 6 = Attended 4-year college / university 7 = Bachelor's degree 8 = Attended graduate or professional school 9    = Master's degree / law degree 10 = Doctoral degree or equivalent

ElementDescription: Age of father figure/primary male caretaker at last birthday
Race/ethnic background of father figure/primary male caretaker
Notes: 1 = Caucasian 2 = African American 3 = Hispanic, black 4 = Hispanic, white 5 = Asian 6 = Native American 7 = Pacific Islander 8 = Other

ElementDescription: Father figure/primary male caretaker fluency in English
Notes: 1 = Fluent in English 2 = Somewhat fluent in English 3 = Not fluent in English

ElementDescription: Teen ever lived in a special residential setting (excluding hospital/medical institution)Items included in the derivation were: FOSTH, JUVDC, BRDSCH, OTHGRP, HOMELS, STREET
Teen currently enrolled in a special education program or classes (excluding Gifted and Talented and Other)Items included in the derivation were: ADDCLS, LEARNDIS, READDIS, BEHPROB, MENTRET
Teen living arrangements with respect to parents
Notes: 1 = Both biological/adoptive parents 2 = One biological/adoptive parent and one step-parent 3 = Single mother 4 = Single father 5 = Neither parent
